question: According to which Constitutional Amendment Act the ministerial advice has been made binding on the Governor of state?
explanation: The Indian Constitution envisages the possibility of the governor acting at times in his discretion but no such possibility has been envisaged for the President of India. According to the 42nd Amendment of 1976 to the Constitution of India the ministerial advice has been made binding on the President, but no such provision has been made with respect to the governor.
